snippet: As congressional candidates take a chance on changing districts, and even states, to try to get elected, they raise the question of whether local ties even matter anymore.
abstract: Congressional races in Maryland and West Virginia are raising question of whether local ties even matter anymore; in West Virginia, Alex X Mooney, former Maryland state senator, moved to state in 2013 and promptly announced his candidacy for congressional seat; in Maryland, neither John Delany, Democratic freshman congressman, nor his Republican challenger Dan Bongino lives in congressional district for which they are vying.
lead_paragraph: As congressional candidates take a chance on changing districts, and even states, to try to get elected, they raise the question of whether local ties even matter anymore.

headline.main: With Eyes on Seats in Maryland and West Virginia, Politicians Cross Borders
headline.print_headline: With Eyes on Seats in Maryland and West Virginia, Politicians Cross Borders
